name: 4h-thieno[2,3-b]thiopyran-2-sulfonamide, 5,6-dih
Reason: 1,2-thiadiazole ring formation introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +70°C. The sulfonamide group introduces a rigid structure with potential hydrogen bonding, adding about +20°C. The thiadiazole ring introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +70°C. The methyl group introduces a bulky side chain, which can sterically hinder the crystal lattice, raising the melting point by approximately +5°C due to the restricted mobility of the basic unit.
